headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; The Banks Convention No. 7--Nomination of Mr. Gooch --The Democratic Convention and Nomination of Mr. Osborne--Mr. Sumner The Public Library Celebration - Who was "Laco?"

docs.lead_paragraph: The Banks Convention in the Seventh Congressional District assembled yesterday, at South Reading, and was quite numerously attended, one hundred delegates being present. contrary to expectation, the Convention was harmonious, and the amount of sparring was small. An informal balloting was had, and icn persons were voted for, receiving 100 votes in all.

headline.main: Increasing the Pay of Naval Officers.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: SIR: Is it not to be hoped that Congress will find time during the present session to consider the matter of an increase in the pay of the officers of the Navy? There is assuredly no branch of the public service demanding a greater sacrifice of personal feelings and comfort than this, yet there is no other receiving so inadequate a compensation. Since tile year 1835.

headline.main: The Washington Union upon the Arrest of General Water..

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Washington Union. The President's Message represents the Administration a; seeking, successfully, by treaty stipulations and amicable, honorable, and legitimate means, to obtain and secure rights of transit, commerce, and peaceful enterprise, for our people, in several portions of the Isthmus.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNEMENT---1858.; Mayor Tiemann at Work--New Appointments at the City Hall--The Two Boards of Common Council and the Supervisors in Session--No Message from the Mayor--Speeches of the Presidents, &c. THE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mayor reached his office at about 10 o'clock yesterday morning. The office was crowded with people-some interested in the apoointments to be made, some attracted by curiosity, and others by a desire to shake hands with Mr. TIEMANN. and congratulate him upon his elevatien. His Honor stood by the large desk in the northwest corner of the room;

headline.main: The Arrest of Walker and his Men.; GREAT INDIGNATION MEETING AT MOBILE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A great Nicaragua Indignation meeting was held to-night, at which resolutions were passed Censuring the Administration, and demanding WALKES'S restoration and the repeat of the neutrality laws. Many prominent Democrats were present and made speeches.
docs.snippet: A great Nicaragua Indignation meeting was held to-night, at which resolutions were passed Censuring the Administration, and demanding WALKES'S restoration and the repeat of the neutrality laws. Many prominent Democrats were present and made speeches.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM JAPAN.; The New Convention Negotiated by Consul-General Harris--Permission to American Citizens to reside at Simoda and Hakediki--Discovery of a Dangerous Reef off Simoda, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have but little news to send you from Hong Kong by this mail. It seems probable, however, that within a month from now the inactivity which the British naval forces have preserved in China since last December will give place to active hostilities. Admiral SEYMOUR maintains a strict blockade of the Canton River, and a great fleet of vessels-of-war is lying in this harbor,
docs.abstract: New treaties effected by Townsend Harris

headline.main: THE INDIAN MUTINIES.; Thrilling Account of the Relief of Lucknow. From Le Pays of Paris.

docs.lead_paragraph: I give you the following account of the relief of Lucknow, as described by a lady, one of the rescued party: On every side death stared us in the face; no human skill could avert it any longer. We saw the moment approach when we must bid farewell to earth, yet without feeling that unutterable horror which must have been experienced by the unhappy victims at Cawnpore.
